stream_context.summary: Kaze models and polishes the overworld (and parts of Course 7) for “Return to Yoshi’s Island,” wrestles with new Windows 11 + Blender 4.2 workflow, and experiments with mushroom floor textures while planning to import a new Luigi character.

development_findings.summary: Course 7 (the carnival/ghost-house area) is restored to full functionality; only the five Yoshi coins remain to be placed.
development_findings.quote: Career 7 is now fully functional again. I just need to add the five Yoshi coins.

development_findings.summary: Kaze migrated to Windows 11, forcing a switch to DaVinci Resolve, Blender 4.2, and other tools; the change introduced slow load times and two blue-screen crashes.
development_findings.quote: The update to Windows 11 means that a lot of the software I use has to change.

development_findings.summary: A custom build of Project64 is in development; its standout improvement is accurate audio and it’s used for real-hardware performance checks.
development_findings.quote: I have a completely custom version of Project 64 now… the audio actually works.

development_findings.summary: Planned feature: add Luigi as a playable character using Pixelpalabra’s model (styled after Biobak’s Mario). Memory is tight, so unused RTYI assets will be purged first.
development_findings.quote: Maybe tomorrow I can start cleaning out some unused files… open up enough memory for Luigi to fit into RAM.

development_findings.summary: Blender work focused on the overworld’s beach/forest edge: new ground planes, 3-D mushroom props, windmill interior, and texture passes.
Technical texture pipeline clarified: CI4 (16-colour) textures need manual palette control; transparent pixels must match ground colour to avoid white outlines under N64 bilinear filtering.
development_findings.quote: Transparent pixels have a colour too… Photoshop always exports them white and you get a white outline.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 cannot use per-vertex light colours, so Kaze plans to place actual light actors in scenes when special effects are needed.
development_findings.quote: If it's for like a special effect, I can add an actual light in 3D space instead of doing the ambient thing.

development_findings.summary: AI-generated textures were tested and rejected: they weren’t seamless, broke style consistency, and would invite community backlash.
development_findings.quote: AI texture generation is nowhere near the level where it can actually be used.

development_findings.summary: Wide-screen mode costs only ~3 FPS on real hardware, confirming acceptable performance headroom.
development_findings.quote: We got 36 FPS… turn on widescreen… 33.5.

development_findings.summary: Upcoming modelling tasks: forest backdrop, Bowser’s oil-tanker hub, and overworld skybox.

context_findings.summary: Kaze questions the value of pre-workout stimulants, noting clearer thinking without them and considering quitting caffeine.
context_findings.quote: I feel like I can speak and think so much clearer when I don't take pre-workout… maybe I'm not gonna.

context_findings.summary: He’s fascinated by automation (automatic lawn-mowers) and even asked Husqvarna for source code to reprogram his own unit.
context_findings.quote: Guys, please let me program the lawnmower. Your program sucks.

context_findings.summary: Financially open to paid side projects: a potential $5k commission to produce a 120-star ‘Groots’ hack in one month.
context_findings.quote: If the guy pays $5 000 for it, then, I mean, it's a good enough deal.

context_findings.summary: Expresses philosophical dislike of corporate performative activism and AI art hype—prefers authenticity and technical rigor.
Mentions two blue-screen crashes and sluggish software since upgrading OS, adding mild frustration and fatigue to the workday.

biobak.summary: Provided the current Mario model that sets the style reference for Pixelpalabra’s Luigi.
Advises on lighting/texture questions (e.g., Fast64 limitations) and discusses texture workflow with Kaze.

zeina.summary: Supplied mushroom-cluster graphic for the overworld ground; iterates with Kaze on transparency, palette, and grass removal.

key_stories.title: The Windows 11 Migration
key_stories.summary: Kaze upgrades his dev PC to Windows 11, forcing a toolchain overhaul and causing stability issues.
key_stories.challenge: Windows 10 was corrupted and nearly out of disk space; support is ending.
key_stories.process: Installed Windows 11, switched from Sony Vegas to DaVinci and from Blender 2.x to 4.2, debugged blue-screens and slow file loads.
key_stories.outcome: Environment mostly works but Blender is sluggish; Kaze continues despite occasional crashes.
key_stories.key_quote: My Windows 10 was completely messed up… I updated to Windows 11 recently, two days ago.

key_stories.title: Bringing Luigi to N64
key_stories.summary: A fresh Luigi character is nearly ready, but RAM constraints require asset clean-up before he fits on hardware.
key_stories.challenge: N64 memory budget is exhausted after existing assets.
key_stories.process: Pixelpalabra modeled Luigi; Kaze plans to delete unused files, compress textures, and import the model.
key_stories.outcome: Import scheduled for the coming week; functionality TBD.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm probably importing the Luigi this week… open up enough memory for Luigi to fit into RAM.

key_stories.title: AI Textures Rejected
key_stories.summary: Chat suggests using AI to create a seamless mushroom floor texture; Kaze tests several prompts but none meet N64 constraints.
key_stories.challenge: Need a low-res, seamless, stylised mushroom texture that fits CI4 limits.
key_stories.process: Prompted web-based generators, inspected outputs, demonstrated palette/indexing issues, and debated community backlash.
key_stories.outcome: AI discarded; Zeina supplies hand-drawn cluster instead.
key_stories.key_quote: AI texture generation is nowhere near the level where it can actually be used.
